attributes.action: rule that the identity of ALL defendants should remain anonymous until the point of conviction.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The identity of all defendants should remain anonymous until the point of conviction. No matter how much the jury are directed to ignore anything they read in the papers and concentrate only on what they have heard in court, in practice most people can’t identify which bit they gleaned from where, and they assume that what is in the papers was what they heard in court – even if the papers have misreported evidence. Banning any reporting before conviction / acquittal will automatically stop this happening. It will also have the effect of protecting the accused but unconvicted from vigilante attacks.
